game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculates the majority of the functionality behind the game.

    Contains all information on what the game board is filled with.

    Author:
    Richard, Julien

      • Board

        public Board(int amount,
             Player[] player)
        Constructor for Board.
        Parameters:
        amount - Number of players joining the current game
        player - Set of Players joining the current game

    • Method Detail

      • addRing

        public void addRing(int x,
                    int y,
                    boolean base,
                    int size,
                    Color e)
        Adds a ring (or a base) to the board.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the ring to be placed
        y - Y coordinate of the ring to be placed
        base - Boolean that, if true, tells the function to place a base instead, regardless of size value
        size - Size of the ring, with 0 being the smallest and 3 being the biggest
        e - Color of the ring to be placed

      • addHome

        public void addHome(int x,
                    int y)
        Adds the home/starting base.

        Is only to be called once.

        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • canPlace

        public boolean canPlace(int x,
                        int y,
                        boolean base,
                        int size,
                        Color color,
                        int currentPlayer)
        Checks whether or not all arguments are in a valid range and valid for placement on the board, in accordance with the game's rules.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate from place to check
        y - Y coordinate from place to check
        base - Boolean that, if true, tells the function to place a base instead, regardless of size value
        size - Size of the ring, with 0 being the smallest and 3 being the biggest
        color - Color of the ring for which to check the place
        currentPlayer - ID of the player currently being checked. To be passed to hasRing() only
        Returns:
        Boolean that says whether or not the current ring configuration is place-able
        See Also:
        hasRing

      • canPlaceCheck

        public boolean canPlaceCheck(int x,
                             int y,
                             boolean base,
                             int size,
                             Color color,
                             int currentPlayer)
        Different type of canPlace() that does not update the ring counter.

        Used for generating a set of possible placement positions.

        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate from place to check
        y - Y coordinate from place to check
        base - Boolean that, if true, tells the function to place a base instead, regardless of size value
        size - Size of the ring, with 0 being the smallest and 3 being the biggest
        color - Color of the ring for which to check the place
        currentPlayer - ID of the player currently being checked. To be passed to hasRing() only
        Returns:
        Boolean that says whether or not the current ring configuration is place-able
        See Also:
        canPlace

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Getter for board size.
        Returns:
        Size of the board in 1 dimension (5 for this board)

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int x,
                    int y)
        Getter for a tile from the board that corresponds with the coordinates given.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of tile to return
        y - Y coordinate of tile to return
        Returns:
        Tile corresponding to coordinates given

      • getPossibleMoves

        public int[] getPossibleMoves(Color color,
                              int playerNumber)
        Creates a array of all possible moves for the given color.
        Parameters:
        color - Color to find moves for
        playerNumber - ID of the player currently being checked. To be passed only
        Returns:
        Array of int of 3 digits, where the first one means x, the second one means y and the third one means ring size (ring size 4 = base). Each int stands for a individual possible move

      • getPossibleMoves

        public int[] getPossibleMoves(Color color,
                              boolean base,
                              int size,
                              int playerNumber)
        Generates an array of possible moves for a particular color and particular ring size.
        Parameters:
        color - Color to find moves for
        base - Boolean that, if true, tells the function to place a base instead, regardless of size value
        size - Size of ring being checked
        playerNumber - ID of the player currently being checked. To be passed only
        Returns:
        Array of int of 2 digits, where the first one means x and the second one means y

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver(boolean[] skipped)
        Checks whether or not the game is over yet, based on amount of players being skipped.
        Parameters:
        skipped - Array of skipped players Size of array corresponds to amount of players in the current game
        Returns:
        true when all players are being skipped

      • hasRing

        public boolean hasRing(boolean base,
                       int size,
                       Color c,
                       int currentPlayer,
                       boolean change)
        Checks if the current ring size can be placed, based on amount of current ring size is left to place for the current player.
        Parameters:
        base - Boolean that specifies whether or not a base is being checked
        size - Size of ring to be checked
        c - Color of ring to be checked
        currentPlayer - ID of player being checked
        change - Boolean that indicates whether or not the values in the ring counter should be modified during this check
        Returns:
        true if current player still has a ring of the current type and color left to place

      • getWinner

        public int getWinner(int[] scores)
        Calculate and broadcast the name of the winner or, in case of a tie, broadcast that the result was a tie.
        Parameters:
        scores - Array of scores per color. Position 0 = Red, 1 = Blue, 2 = Green, and 3 = Yellow
        Returns:
        ID of winner. In case of a tie, returns 5

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
